author: Mariam Abdullahi
title: 'Nigeria has the capacity to manufacture vaccines' - Tinubu informs Gavi executives - NewsNow Nigeria
text:
President Bola Tinubu has urged Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance, to team up with potential Nigerian vaccine producers to ensure fair access to life-saving vaccines for both children and adults.
During a meeting with a delegation from Gavi, headed by its CEO, Dr. Sania Nishtar, at the State House on Thursday, President Tinubu emphasized the need for collaboration in local vaccine production due to the challenges faced by developing nations, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic and other infectious disease outbreaks.
Highlighting the capabilities of Nigeria and other African countries in vaccine production, President Tinubu assured the visiting CEO, who assumed office on March 18, 2024, and has been on visits to various African nations.
The President reassured the Gavi CEO of Nigeria’s dedication to meeting its outstanding counterpart contributions for routine vaccines in 2023.
He instructed the Coordinating Minister of Health and Social Welfare, Professor Muhammad Ali Pate, to team up with the Coordinating Minister of the Economy and Minister of Finance to secure the necessary funds for vaccine procurement.
Talking about the administration’s healthcare agenda, President Tinubu expressed his commitment to working alongside Gavi to ensure comprehensive vaccination coverage for all children against preventable childhood diseases.
Appreciating Gavi’s global commitment to humanity, he thanked the organization for its efforts in safeguarding children from preventable diseases.
In recognizing the valuable insights provided by the Gavi CEO, who hails from Pakistan, President Tinubu stressed the significance of leveraging her expertise for the advancement of children’s health.
Praising Dr. Nishtar for her visit to Nigeria and her support for the administration’s health initiatives, the President promised to prioritize investments in healthcare rejuvenation, underscoring the importance of coordination and cooperation among federal, state, and local authorities.
